intro: Sedum spectabile purpureum, commonly known as the showy sedum, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and clusters of showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant pink to purple blooms in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid conditions with minimal care.
